context: The Finnish verb 'kuulla' means 'to hear' or 'to listen to'. It's an active verb that indicates the action of perceiving sound through hearing. In different conjugations, it can appear as 'kuulen' (I hear), 'kuulet' (you hear/hear you), 'kuulee' (he/she/it hears), 'kuulumme' (we hear), 'kuulatte' (you all hear), and 'kuulevat' (they hear).
